The photoreduction of CO 2 by various catalysts has been extensively studied 171819.The following reaction was proposed for the selective production of CH 3 OH: Prior to the photocatalytic reaction, the TiO 2 catalyst was dispersed in distilled water and irradiated by UV light from a high-pressure mercury lamp for 5 h, aiming to remove any organic residues on TiO 2 surface.We carried out control experiments in dark first and no CH where I is

reaction, all catalyst samples dispersed in distilled water were irradiated by UV light from high-pressure mercury lamp for 10 h to eliminate organic residues on the TiO 2 surface, if any.The as-prepared samples could act as catalyst for reduction of CO 2 and methanol amount is proportional to the light irradiation time.As expected, the methanol yield of the flower-like particles (0.569 mol g -1 h -1 ) was much higher than that of the rod-like particles (0.388 mol g -1 h -1 ) despite the lower specific
